original: EXHIBIT B MUTUAL TERMINATION AGREEMENT THIS MUTUAL TERMINATION AGREEMENT (“ Termination Agreement ”) is made and entered into this  day of , 2009, by and between Beijing SINA Internet Information Service Co. (“ Beijing SINA ”) and Shanghai SINA Leju Information Technology Co. Ltd. (“ SINA Leju ”).
modified:
EXHIBIT B MUTUAL DISMISSAL AGREEMENT THIS DISMISSAL AGREEMENT (" Dismissal Agreement "), entered into on this day of , 2009, is made between the parties Beijing SINA Internet Information Service Co. (" Beijing SINA ") and Shanghai SINA Leju Information Technology Co. Ltd. (" SINA Leju ").

In this agreement, instead of termination, we have used the term 'dismissal', suggesting a more final or definitive action. This minor change subtly indicates that once this agreement is executed, there may be no room for reconsideration or reversal of the dismissal decision by either party.

original: WHEREAS, Beijing SINA and SINA Leju entered into that certain Domain Name License Agreement dated May 8, 2008 (the “ Original Agreement ”); and WHEREAS, Beijing SINA and SINA Leju desire to mutually terminate the Original Agreement effective as of the date of this Termination Agreement.
ollama_generated:
WHEREAS, SINA Leju and Beijing SINA initially executed a Domain Name License Agreement, dated May 8, 2008 (the "Initial Agreement"), and; WHEREAS, in light of subsequent events, it is now deemed advantageous for both parties to unilaterally terminate the Initial Agreement effective from the date of this Termination Notice, issued voluntarily by SINA Leju.

This modification emphasizes that the termination is initiated by one party (SINA Leju) rather than a mutual agreement, and it also uses "Termination Notice" instead of "Termination Agreement."

original: NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and conditions contained herein, and other good and valuable consideration, receipt of which is hereby acknowledged by each of the parties hereto, the parties agree as follows:
ollama_generated:
HEREBY, IN EXCHANGE FOR THE MUTUAL AGREEES AND STIPULATIONS PRESENT WITHIN THIS DOCUMENT, AND OTHER SUFFICIENT CONSIDERATION RECEIVED WHICH IS ACKNOWLEDGED BY EACH PARTY INVOLVED, THE PARTIES HEREIN SHALL COME TO AN UNDERSTANDING AS STATED:

This modification slightly modifies the original clause by shifting the focus to the understanding reached by the parties rather than the mutual covenants and conditions contained within the document. It also inverts the structure of the original clause, moving from the consideration first to the agreement that follows.

original: 2. This Termination Agreement represents the complete, integrated, and entire agreement between the parties, and may not be modified except in writing signed by the parties.
ollama_generated: 2. This Termination Agreement serves as the sole and binding expression of the agreement reached between the parties; no oral or implied understandings shall supplement or modify this agreement, unless such modifications are made in writing and signed by all parties.

original: Beijing SINA Internet Information Service  Co., Ltd.
modified:
Shall not be held liable for any delays or failures in the performance of its services, including but not limited to, disruptions or interruptions caused by force majeure events, acts of god, or third-party actions, unless such delays or failures result from Beijing SINA Internet Information Service Co., Ltd.'s gross negligence or willful misconduct.

In the event of any disputes arising out of or in connection with this agreement, Beijing SINA Internet Information Service Co., Ltd. reserves the right to seek resolution through mediation before initiating any legal proceedings. The mediator shall be mutually agreed upon by both parties, and the costs of the mediation process will be borne equally by both parties. If the dispute remains unresolved following the mediation process, either party may pursue legal action in a court having jurisdiction over the matter.

This agreement supersedes all prior negotiations, understandings, and agreements between the parties, whether written or oral. This clause shall apply to any modifications, amendments, or additions made to this agreement during its term. In the event of any conflict or inconsistency between this clause and other provisions of this agreement, this clause shall take precedence.

Any waiver by either party of any breach of this agreement by the other party shall not be construed as a continuing waiver of such breaches or of any subsequent breaches. The invalidity or unenforceability of any provision of this agreement shall not affect the validity or enforceability of any other provisions. In the event that any provision of this agreement is found to be invalid or unenforceable, the parties agree to negotiate in good faith to replace such provision with a valid and enforceable one that achieves the intended commercial result to the extent possible under applicable law.

original: Shanghai SINA Leju Information Technology Co.  Ltd.
ollama_generated:
The Responsibility Regarding Liability Shifts Solely to Shanghai SINA Leju Information Technology Co. Ltd:

In any event arising from this agreement, it shall be the exclusive obligation of Shanghai SINA Leju Information Technology Co. Ltd to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless the other party from any and all liabilities, losses, damages, claims, actions, judgments, costs, or expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, that may arise out of or in connection with this agreement or its performance by Shanghai SINA Leju Information Technology Co. Ltd.

In essence, the burden of potential liabilities has been completely shifted to Shanghai SINA Leju Information Technology Co. Ltd under this clause.

original: Source: LEJU HOLDINGS LTD, DRS (on F-1), 1/21/2014
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: REVISED LEJU HOLDINGS LTD, DR (on F-1), 1/21/2014

The Contractor shall make every reasonable effort to deliver the Goods by the Delivery Date, but in the event that unforeseen circumstances beyond the Contractor's control cause a delay in delivery, the Contractor shall not be liable for any damages or penalties, provided that the Contractor promptly notifies the Buyer of such delay and makes reasonable efforts to expedite delivery as soon as possible. In case the Contractor fails to deliver the Goods within a period of 30 days after the Delivery Date, the Buyer shall have the right to terminate this Agreement without any liability towards the Contractor, and the Contractor shall return to the Buyer any advance payment received for the Goods.

In this revised version, the Contractor's obligation to deliver goods by the agreed delivery date remains, but they are not liable for damages or penalties if unforeseen circumstances beyond their control cause a delay in delivery. Additionally, the buyer now has the right to terminate the agreement without liability towards the contractor if the goods are not delivered within 30 days of the delivery date, and the contractor is obligated to return any advance payment received for the goods upon termination.
